components should dispatch an event that contains the return data

question.feedback: True. You can automatically use a static constant as the source for a data-binding expression. Flex performs the data binding once when the application starts. Because the data binding occurs only once at application start up, you omit the [Bindable] metadata tag for the static constant. You cannot use the [Bindable] metadata tag with a static variable. If you do, the compiler issues an error.

item.question: True or False: You can automatically use a static constant as the source for a data-binding expression without having to use the [Bindable] metadata tag.

question.feedback: B and C are correct. Modules do not support multi-versioning and are more tightly bound to the host application. Modules and sub-applications are also different. The main difference is that modules typically share classes with their host application. This sharing of classes creates a dependency between the module and the main application. Sub-applications, on the other hand, typically have their own versions of the classes, so less dependency exists between them and the main application.

item.question: Which of the following options are true about the differences between modules and sub-applications? Choose two:
item.answer: Modules are more tightly bound to the host application
Both can be recompiled without having to recompile the main application

question.feedback: True. You can bind more than one source property to the same destination property. You can set up one of these bindings by using curly braces, but you must set up the others by using the <fx:Binding> tag, or by using calls to the BindingUtils.bindProperty() method or to the BindingUtils.bindSetter() method.

item.question: True or false? You can bind more than one source property to the same destination property of a component.

question.feedback: True. If you do not identify an event in the class file with the [Event] metadata tag, the compiler generates an error when an MXML component attempts to register a listener for that event. Any component can register an event listener for the event in ActionScript using the addEventListener() method, even if you omit the [Event] metadata tag.

item.question: True or false? If you create a custom event and do NOT use the Event meta data tag before the class, MXML components cannot listen for that event.But other ActionScript classes can still listen for that event

question.feedback: A and C are correct. Dynamic parts are instantiated when needed. There can be more than one instance of a dynamic part. Dynamic parts are defined in the Declarations block of a skin so that one or more instances of the part can be instantiated and used by the skin. The Slider class DataTip, for example, is a dynamic skin part. In the VSliderSkin and HSliderSkin, the dataTip skin part is defined in a Declarations block.

item.question: Which are the examples of dynamic skin parts as opposed to static skin parts? Choose two:
